page.title: 09LOCAL HISTORY,CHANGING TIMES
page.content: One of our oldest inhabitants Mr. Chalke who has lived in the village for fifty years came and told us about what it used to be like.He used to be the postman.In 1932 Rushwick was 3 hamlets which gradually grew until they joined together to become one village. The only transport was by train.There was no bus service. As the roads had so little traffic it was safe to play in the road & one of the games the children played was tip an cap. Rushwick School was built in 1964.It had originally been at Crown East but was moved to the village.It had only two new classrooms,a hall & a library. Mr. Chalke has seen a great many changes in our village in fifty years.
